did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: Author, journalist, screenwriter, and adjunct professor at Loyola College in Maryland. Papers contain research materials for Bowden's book about the Iran hostage crisis (1979-1981), published as Guests of the Ayatollah: The First Battle in America's War with Militant Islam (NY: Atlantic Monthly Press, 2006). Materials include interview transcripts with American hostages, Iranian hostage takers, and members of the United States military who were involved in the 1980 rescue attempt. Collection also contains many research files and clippings.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
Electronic files are present in this collection; please consult with a reference archivist for access to these materials.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Mark Bowden Papers were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 2006.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accession 2006-0082 is described in this finding aid.

chronitem.event: Graduated from Loyola College of Maryland with a B.A. in English Literature
Worked as staff writer for The Philadelphia Inquirer
Published Doctor Dealer: The Rise and Fall of an All-American Boy and His Multimillion-Dollar Cocaine Empire
Publication of Black Hawk Down: A Story of Modern War
Published Killing Pablo: The Hunt for the World's Greatest Outlaw
Published Our Finest Day : D-Day, June 6, 1944
Publication of Finders Keepers: The Story of a Man Who Found $1 Million
Publication of Road Work : Among Tyrants, Heroes, Rogues, and Beasts
Published Guests of the Ayatollah: The First Battle in America's War with Militant Islam

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The Mark Bowden Papers span the dates 1972-2004, and contain research materials for Bowden's book about the Iran hostage crisis (1979-1981), published as Guests of the Ayatollah: The First Battle in America's War with Militant Islam (NY: Atlantic Monthly Press, 2006). Materials include transcripts of Bowden's interviews with many dozens of individuals, including American hostages, Iranian hostage takers, and members of the United States military who were involved in the 1980 rescue attempt. Also present in the collection are extensive bound notebooks of press clippings, and many research files. These files contain documents related to the U.S. government's role in the hostage crisis and its relations with Iran, as well as articles by other authors on Iran and the hostage crisis. Specific materials can be found on the CIA, the Department of Defense, and President Carter's administration.

archref.unittitle: Tim Wells Papers, 1982-1986: background materials, including oral interviews, relating to Well’s book about the Iran hostage crisis (1979-1981).
archref.repository: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

scopecontent.p: Arranged alphabetically by last name. Consists primarily of two periods during which Bowden carried out interviews: 1982-1984 and 2002-2004. Original electronic media have been removed and files have been mounted to a library server; for access to these materials please consult with a reference archivist before coming to use the collection.
Consists primarily of research materials for the book Guests of the Ayatollah. Arranged alphabetically by subject.

did.unittitle: Buck, Peter, The Iranian Rescue Mission: a Case Study

scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence, handwritten notes, speeches, and Pentagon chronology.
Includes Jimmy Carter, Rosalyn Carter and then-Governor Bill Clinton.

did.unittitle: Jimmy Carter and the decision to admit the Shah of Iran into the United States: Confustion and Questions Linger, 2003

scopecontent.p: Includes articles, Department of Defense briefing, Iranian report, House hearing testimony and other documents.
Consists of correspondence, poems and a selection from memoir Women Imprisioned in the Kingdom of Mullahs.

did.unittitle: Iranian propaganda effort after the rescue attempt
Iran, the making of U.S. Policy, 1977-1980, NS Archives
Roeder et al. vs. Iran, transcript, 2001

scopecontent.p: Includes articles, book reviews and thesis on former Iran hostages.
Includes correspondence, memorandums, intelligence assessments and presidential directives.

did.unittitle: Wolf, Kendal, Iran Hostage Crisis Rescue Mission: Lessons Learned and Applied or Successes from Failure, 2004
Moayyad, Heshmat, ed. Stories from Iran

scopecontent.p: Contains electronic files from eight floppy disks, five cds and one mini disc of interviews.
